content.description: 10 feet Right of the very left end of the rock face climb up to a shallow lay-back crack, then continue up and left to the top.  fun problem.  Walk off the back.
On the far left side of the wall climb straight up the slippery face climb. 5.11???
content.protection: Top rope with slings unless someone bolts it.

content.description: Climb the wall just left of the wide crack on the right center face. Protection is a little funky.  Going up the unprotected dish at the top past one bolt makes it 5.9-.
content.protection: Top rope off of two bolts.  Gear to 4 inches.  One bolt.

content.description: Crux near the start off of a finger jam.  Poorly placed gear can mess up where your hands go.  Fun crack that takes gear well.
content.protection: Nuts and cams 0.5 to 4 inches.  Anchors at top.
content.location:
First crack left of

A Delicate Dance

(20-25 feet from right edge of the wall).  Rap off or walk off.  Route is just right of a large, loose, flake system.  The flake looks very climable, but the whole thing may come off the wall if you hang on it.

content.description: Take the obvious wide crack on the right center face up to the top.
content.protection: Good gear, to 4 inches or top rope with long slings.

content.description:
Start 12 feet right of

Can't or Won't

.  Follow the shallow scoop and thin crack up laying left off the crack past two bolts. (5.10). A small nut can be wiggled in below the first bolt.  Reach for the jugs and haul up going left around a flake (cams to 1 1/2 in.).  Two bolt anchor at top.
content.protection: Top rope from anchors or lead with two bolts and gear to 1 1/2 inches.

content.description: Very right side of the wall up the blunt arete.   5.9 if you go left of the bolts, 5.7 if you go right.

There is a ramp and an arching crack that starts at the ground and runs up and right  thru the face.  Climb the bulging start past a bolt, 5.10, to the narrow stance on the ramp.  clip the bolt and do a no hands jump to catch the arching crack, 5.10/11 height dependent.  Continue up and right past 4 more bolts to two cracks that go up, (5.11), small gear is useful here.
content.protection: There is difficult to place protection on this one bolt route.  Cams to 1-1/2 - 2 inches and small to medium size nuts for the cracks near the top.  Safe fun top rope.

content.description: Climb 5.9 ground up past two bolts.  Tiptoe left up inclined edge, clip the third bolt and "dance" delicatly up and right on ever decreasing slabby foot holds and finger crimpers.  Gain the rounded right side of the rock and up easier ground to two bold anchor.  Very fun.
content.protection: 3 bolts to two bolt anchor.  Crux well protected.
content.location: Second bolted route from the far right side of the becker wall on a clean granite face.  Start directly under the first bolt.  Rap off or walk off.

content.description: 20 feet right of the left end of the rock a deep fold or off width exist.  A thin crack winds up the inside face to a small roof and finishes with a short face.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches.  One 2-3 foot sling.
